titles.title: The surprising origins of the word “lesbian” - Diane J. Rayor

questions.question: Who was the ancient Greek poet celebrated for her intimate and personal poetry about love, passion, and longing?

options.label: A
options.text: Sappho

options.label: B
options.text: Ovid

options.label: C
options.text: Homer

options.label: D
options.text: Aristophanes

questions.question: What instrument did Sappho typically play while singing her songs, which also gave rise to the term "lyrics" in poetry?

options.label: A
options.text: Lyre

options.label: B
options.text: Harp

options.label: C
options.text: Flute

options.label: D
options.text: Drums

questions.question: What is the origin of the term "lyrics" in poetry, and how is it related to Sappho's performances?

options.label: A
options.text: From the Greek word for "song"

options.label: B
options.text: From the name of a famous poet

options.label: C
options.text: From the instrument "lyre" that Sappho played

options.label: D
options.text: From the Latin word for "verse"

questions.question: How would you describe the tone of Sappho's poetry, particularly when she writes about love and desire?

options.label: A
options.text: Formal and objective, reflecting the societal norms of ancient Greece

options.label: B
options.text: Intimate and personal, offering a unique perspective on love and desire

options.label: C
options.text: Sarcastic and humorous, poking fun at the conventions of love

options.label: D
options.text: Angry and bitter, reflecting a sense of frustration and disillusionment

questions.question: What were the social norms regarding marriage and relationships in ancient Greece, and how did they differ for men and women?

options.label: A
options.text: Men and women were free to choose their partners, and same-sex relationships were widely accepted

options.label: B
options.text: Everyone was expected to marry and have children, but men were allowed to have extramarital relationships

options.label: C
options.text: Only men were allowed to have homosexual relationships, while women were expected to be chaste

options.label: D
options.text: Women were allowed to have multiple husbands, while men were expected to be monogamous

questions.question: Why do you think Sappho's poetry was neglected or destroyed by monks and Christian leaders?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it was considered too secular and did not conform to Christian values

options.label: B
options.text: Because it was deemed too erotic and licentious, and was seen as a threat to moral standards

options.label: C
options.text: Because it was written by a woman, and was therefore considered inferior or unimportant

options.label: D
options.text: Because it was too old-fashioned and no longer relevant to contemporary society

questions.question: What is the current state of Sappho's surviving work, and what are the prospects for recovering more of her poetry in the future?

options.label: A
options.text: We have all of her poems and songs, and there is no need for further recovery efforts

options.label: B
options.text: We have around 50% of her total known work, and more is likely to be discovered in the future

options.label: C
options.text: We have less than 10% of her total known work, but new technologies and discoveries may lead to the recovery of more poetry

options.label: D
options.text: We have none of her original work, and it is unlikely that any will be recovered in the future

questions.question: How do you think the historical rumors about Sappho's life, such as her falling in love with a ferryman, reflect the attitudes of the time towards her and her work?

options.label: A
options.text: They show a deep respect for her work and legacy, and a desire to understand her as a person

options.label: B
options.text: They demonstrate a neutral and objective view of her life, and a commitment to factual accuracy

options.label: C
options.text: They reveal a misogynistic and homophobic bias, and a desire to marginalize or erase her

options.label: D
options.text: They indicate a lack of interest in her personal life, and a focus on her poetry alone

questions.question: What does the phrase "I say someone in another time will remember us" suggest about Sappho's hopes for her legacy?

options.label: A
options.text: She wanted to be forgotten after her death, and did not care about her legacy

options.label: B
options.text: She hoped her work would be remembered for a short time, but did not expect it to endure

options.label: C
options.text: She believed her words would endure across time, and would continue to resonate with readers

options.label: D
options.text: She was unsure about the impact of her poetry, and did not know if it would be remembered

questions.question: Why do you think Sappho's poetry continues to resonate with readers today, despite being written over 2,500 years ago?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it deals with universal themes of love and desire that are still relevant today

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is a product of its time and reflects ancient Greek culture, which is still studied and admired today

options.label: C
options.text: Because it is a rare example of ancient Greek literature, and is therefore valuable for historical and scholarly purposes

options.label: D
options.text: Because it has been extensively studied and analyzed by scholars, who have helped to keep it alive and relevant

titles.title: Why I'm done trying to be "man enough" - Justin Baldoni

questions.question: What is the speaker's most well-known role as an actor, which he mentions in the talk?

options.label: A
options.text: Rafael

options.label: B
options.text: Male Escort #1

options.label: C
options.text: Shirtless Medical Student

options.label: D
options.text: Shirtless Steroid-Using Con Man

questions.question: According to the speaker, what is the primary issue with the traditional definition of masculinity that has been passed down to men from generation to generation?

options.label: A
options.text: It emphasizes the importance of emotional intelligence and sensitivity.

options.label: B
options.text: It promotes a narrow and limiting definition of masculinity that discourages vulnerability and emotional expression.

options.label: C
options.text: It encourages men to be aggressive and dominant in their relationships.

options.label: D
options.text: It fails to recognize the importance of strength and bravery in men.

questions.question: What values did the speaker's father teach him about being a man, according to the talk?

options.label: A
options.text: Traditional masculine traits like strength, aggression, and dominance

options.label: B
options.text: Emotional intelligence, sensitivity, and sacrifice for the family

options.label: C
options.text: Independence, self-reliance, and individualism

options.label: D
options.text: Dominance, control, and power over others

questions.question: How has the speaker been practicing vulnerability, according to the talk?

options.label: A
options.text: By avoiding conversations about his struggles and insecurities

options.label: B
options.text: By posting about his accomplishments on social media

options.label: C
options.text: By having open conversations with his guy friends about his struggles and insecurities

options.label: D
options.text: By going on solo trips to foreign countries

questions.question: What is the problem with traditional masculine norms, according to the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: They promote emotional intelligence, sensitivity, and vulnerability

options.label: B
options.text: They promote a narrow and limiting definition of masculinity that discourages emotional expression and vulnerability

options.label: C
options.text: They promote aggression, violence, and dominance

options.label: D
options.text: They promote a lack of accountability and responsibility

questions.question: Why does the speaker think that only women are engaging with his content on social media, despite his efforts to reach more men?

options.label: A
options.text: Men are not interested in discussing gender equality and vulnerability

options.label: B
options.text: Women are more open to discussing gender equality and vulnerability

options.label: C
options.text: Social media is not an effective platform for promoting gender equality

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker's approach to promoting gender equality is flawed

questions.question: How does the speaker challenge men to redefine what it means to be strong and brave?

options.label: A
options.text: By embracing traditional masculine traits like aggression and dominance

options.label: B
options.text: By embracing emotional intelligence, sensitivity, and vulnerability

options.label: C
options.text: By embracing independence, self-reliance, and individualism

options.label: D
options.text: By ignoring the need for change

questions.question: What does the speaker's experience of confronting his own biases and privileges as a man suggest about the process of promoting gender equality?

options.label: A
options.text: It requires men to recognize and challenge their own biases and privileges

options.label: B
options.text: It requires women to take on more leadership roles and responsibilities

options.label: C
options.text: It requires a fundamental transformation of societal norms and institutions

options.label: D
options.text: It requires men to become more aggressive and dominant

questions.question: What does the passage from the Bahá'í writings suggest about the importance of gender equality?

options.label: A
options.text: It is necessary for the advancement of humanity and the promotion of peace and justice

options.label: B
options.text: It is necessary for the empowerment of women and the promotion of feminist ideals

options.label: C
options.text: It is necessary for the promotion of traditional masculine traits and values

options.label: D
options.text: It is necessary for the maintenance of social order and stability

questions.question: What does the speaker's conclusion about teaching children to be good humans suggest about the role of education in promoting gender equality?

options.label: A
options.text: It should focus on promoting traditional masculine traits and values

options.label: B
options.text: It should focus on promoting emotional intelligence, sensitivity, and vulnerability

options.label: C
options.text: It should focus on challenging societal norms and institutions

options.label: D
options.text: It should focus on ignoring the need for change
